00:00:00:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:00:120000.Dialogue: You feel like trying something new for dinner? Maybe Indian, Tex-Mex?

00:00:05:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:05:020000.Dialogue: You ever wonder how humans would be different if they evolved from lizards instead of mammals?

00:00:16:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:16:020000.Dialogue: As you know, lizards-- cold-blooded animals-- lack the ability to sense temperature. But they do move more sluggishly when it's cold. So, lizard weathermen would say things like, Bring a sweater, it's slow outside.

00:00:34:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:34:210000.Dialogue: We all do. Now, how about dinner?

00:00:37:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:37:200000.Dialogue: Oh, I would assume we'd enjoy insects or smaller lizards.

00:00:42:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:42:010000.Dialogue: We could also pull each other's tails off and grill them; they'll just grow back.

00:00:48:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:48:180000.Dialogue: Oh! My life-size cardboard Mr. Spock is here!

00:00:53:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:53:170000.Dialogue: I know he wouldn't care for an outburst of human emotion, but, oh, goodie, oh, goodie, oh, goodie.

00:01:01:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:01:120000.Dialogue: Commander Spock requesting permission to be unfolded.

00:01:11:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:11:190000.Dialogue: Which is why the more intelligent the monkey, the more feces they fling.

00:01:18:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:18:120000.Dialogue: Excuse me, Amy. Penny, do you have plans for dinner tonight?

00:01:23:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:23:210000.Dialogue: No, I mean just you and me.

00:01:28:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:28:060000.Dialogue: Not like a date, a date.

00:01:42:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:42:230000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Oh, no! They sent the wrong Spock!

00:01:48:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:48:100000.Dialogue: Live long and suck it, Zachary Quinto.

00:01:56:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:56:060000.Dialogue: This is so exciting. If Leonard and Penny get back together, Howard and I can go on double dates with them.

00:02:02:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:02:060000.Dialogue: How come you never invite Sheldon and me on a double date?

00:02:06:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:06:050000.Dialogue: Mm, uh... How's it going in there, Penny?!

00:02:11:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:11:130000.Dialogue: PENNY: Just a sec. Too much?

00:02:24:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:24:020000.Dialogue: You just can't handle her raw sexuality, can you?

00:02:27:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:27:210000.Dialogue: When did you and Leonard break up?

00:02:32:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:32:180000.Dialogue: Why do you think he asked you out again?

00:02:36:000000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:36:000000.Dialogue: Maybe he's dying. That would be so romantic.

00:02:43:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:43:110000.Dialogue: If he were, she could just throw him in bed and ride him right up until he flatlines.

00:03:00:130000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:03:00:130000.Dialogue: Do you think you'll sleep with him tonight?

00:03:02:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:02:160000.Dialogue: PENNY: Absolutely not. Look, we're just gonna have dinner and, you know, see how it goes.

00:03:07:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:07:030000.Dialogue: If he were dying, would you sleep with him?

00:03:10:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:10:230000.Dialogue: Assuming he were dying of something that couldn't be sexually transmitted.

00:03:15:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:15:080000.Dialogue: You know, like a spear wound to the head.

00:03:20:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:20:100000.Dialogue: How do you know? Are you a doctor?

00:03:23:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:03:23:020000.Dialogue: You can make-believe, though. Sometimes Howard and I pretend that his arrhythmia is acting up and I'm a sexy cardiologist.

00:03:30:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:03:30:040000.Dialogue: And the naughty part is I'm not in his HMO network.

00:03:37:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:37:040000.Dialogue: Screw it. I'm not gonna make a big deal out of this. It's just dinner.

00:03:44:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:44:210000.Dialogue: Amy, stop it. Oh, God, I'm so nervous.

00:03:48:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:03:48:050000.Dialogue: BERNADETTE: Relax. You know Leonard's always been crazy about you. It's gonna be great.

00:03:52:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:52:190000.Dialogue: I know, but we've finally gotten to a place where we can hang out without it being weird. And what if something goes wrong? Then what?

00:03:58:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:58:010000.Dialogue: Guess it'll just be Sheldon and me going on a double date with Howard and Bernadette.

00:04:06:090000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:06:090000.Dialogue: Change your clothes; we got a lot riding on this.

00:04:15:020000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:04:15:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:15:020000.Dialogue: Mm... I want to build a road, but I need wood.

00:04:22:170000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:04:22:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:22:170000.Dialogue: Do either of you fellows have wood?

00:04:31:060000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:04:31:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:04:34:190000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:04:34:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:34:190000.Dialogue: The object of Settlers of Catan is to build roads and settlements. To do so requires wood. Now, I have sheep; I need wood.

00:04:45:040000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:04:45:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:45:040000.Dialogue: Who has wood for my sheep?

00:04:50:060000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:04:50:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:52:210000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:04:52:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:52:210000.Dialogue: More to the point, why are you doing this?

00:04:55:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:04:55:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:56:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:04:56:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:56:110000.Dialogue: Did you forget what Penny did to you? It took you two years and defiling my sister to turn that frown upside down.

00:05:02:180000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:02:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:02:180000.Dialogue: I didn't defile your sister, we had a relationship.

00:05:06:020000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:06:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:06:020000.Dialogue: I heard you call her Brown Sugar.

00:05:09:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:09:150000.Speaker: Raj

00:05:12:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:12:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:12:110000.Dialogue: You want to know my opinion?

00:05:14:000000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:14:000000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:16:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:16:110000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:18:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:18:150000.Speaker: Howard

00:05:20:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:20:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:24:120000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:24:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:24:120000.Dialogue: The reason you're fixated on a good-natured simpleton like Penny is that she's the exact opposite of your first romantic attachment: your brilliant yet intimidating mother.

00:05:34:020000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:34:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:34:020000.Dialogue: Where on earth did you get that from?

00:05:36:080000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:36:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:36:080000.Dialogue: It's in her book, Needy Baby, Greedy Baby.

00:05:41:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:41:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:43:190000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:43:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:43:190000.Dialogue: It's called nonfiction for a reason, Leonard.

00:05:46:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:46:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:49:160000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:49:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:49:160000.Dialogue: If they ever make a movie version of that book, you know who should play Leonard's mother? Sandra Bullock.

00:05:56:080000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:56:080000.Speaker: Howard

00:05:57:140000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:05:57:140000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:03:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:06:03:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:03:230000.Dialogue: Now, where were we? Oh, yes. Does anyone have any wood?

00:06:09:120000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:06:09:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:09:120000.Dialogue: Oh, come on! I just want wood.

00:06:12:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game.
00:06:12:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:12:150000.Dialogue: Why are you making it so hard?

00:06:23:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:23:000000.Dialogue: So, do they have a name for a first date with someone you used to go out with?

00:06:27:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:27:180000.Dialogue: Oh, that's a good question. How about awkward?

00:06:36:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:36:040000.Dialogue: Hey, how about if we pretend we're actually on a first date? See how that goes.

00:06:44:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:44:080000.Dialogue: So, Polly, tell me about yourself.

00:06:53:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:53:050000.Dialogue: Okay, uh, let's see. I'm from Nebraska, and ever since I was a little girl, I dreamed of moving to L.A. and becoming a movie star. Anyway, after four years of acting lessons and waiting tables, I've done a hemorrhoid commercial and a production of Anne Frank above a bowling alley.

00:07:10:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:10:130000.Dialogue: So, you know, dreams do come true.

00:07:15:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:15:120000.Dialogue: Uh, let's see. Uh, I am an experimental physicist at Cal-Tech, most of my research is with high-powered lasers, and, oh, I've just gotten a big government grant to see if they can be used to knock out incoming ballistic missiles.

00:07:38:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:38:230000.Dialogue: And I used the equipment to make my own Bat-signal.

00:07:43:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:43:150000.Dialogue: Bat-signal? What are you, some kind of nerd?

00:07:46:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:46:060000.Dialogue: Not some kind of nerd, I'm the king of the nerds.

00:07:55:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:55:110000.Dialogue: Uh, it means if anyone displeases me, I don't help them set up their printer.

00:08:03:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:03:230000.Dialogue: Good. Remember that when I take my shirt off.

00:08:10:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:10:040000.Dialogue: Leonard, this is nice. I'm so glad we did this.

00:08:12:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:12:120000.Dialogue: Me, too. So what do you think? Are we gonna get back together?

00:08:20:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:20:160000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, what did I say?

00:08:22:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:22:130000.Dialogue: Leonard, you know I will always have feelings for you.

00:08:27:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:27:200000.Dialogue: You said always. You'll always have feelings for me.

00:08:31:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:31:180000.Dialogue: So, that sounds more like something you'd say if you didn't want a relationship with someone. This isn't working out, but I'll always have feelings for you. I'm sorry I slept with your best friend, but I'll always have feelings for you.

00:08:43:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:43:080000.Dialogue: Here's the thing, Lisa, I'm into dudes now, but I'll always have feelings for you.

00:08:56:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:56:120000.Dialogue: Yes, you are. You always overthink things.

00:08:59:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:59:030000.Dialogue: Th-There you go. Always made it worse.

00:09:02:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:02:150000.Dialogue: See, this is where everything goes wrong: when we talk.

00:09:06:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:06:000000.Dialogue: Well, I don't know how you have a relationship without talking.

00:09:10:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:10:190000.Dialogue: Hey, I went out with this guy TJ for eight months, we never talked. To this day, I don't even know what TJ stands for.

00:09:15:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:15:210000.Dialogue: Wait, if you guys didn't talk, what-- Never mind, stupid question.

00:09:23:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:23:130000.Dialogue: And now that I have some wood,

00:09:27:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:27:130000.Dialogue: I'm going to begin the erection of my settlement.

00:09:32:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:32:220000.Dialogue: He's got to be doing this on purpose.

00:09:40:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:40:090000.Dialogue: You and Penny decide to go out and paint the town beige?

00:09:43:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:43:210000.Dialogue: You're 30 years old and you live with your mother.

00:09:49:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:49:210000.Dialogue: I guess it didn't go well.

00:09:51:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:51:210000.Dialogue: We don't know that. Not to a certainty. All we know is that Leonard is home.

00:10:02:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:02:180000.Dialogue: Again, not enough evidence. For all we know, he's being murdered.

00:10:12:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:12:090000.Dialogue: You were in the middle of an erection.

00:10:18:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:18:210000.Dialogue: Oh, of course. It's right here in my hand.

00:10:36:020000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard’s phone text signal sounds.
00:10:36:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:36:020000.Dialogue: What does she want from me now? What's up?

00:10:44:070000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard’s phone text signal sounds.
00:10:44:070000.Speaker: Penny

00:10:54:010000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard’s phone text signal sounds.
00:10:54:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:57:030000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard’s phone text signal sounds.
00:10:57:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:57:030000.Dialogue: Okay, but earlier it seemed like...

00:10:59:120000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard’s phone text signal sounds.
00:10:59:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:03:040000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard’s phone text signal sounds.
00:11:03:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:03:040000.Dialogue: Even during? 'Cause sometimes I have questions.

00:11:14:180000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:14:180000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:18:030000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:18:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:18:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, except for when I got the foot cramp.

00:11:20:210000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:20:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:22:140000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:22:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:22:140000.Dialogue: There was a lot at stake.

00:11:25:100000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:25:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:25:100000.Dialogue: So what do you want to do now?

00:11:28:030000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:28:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:28:030000.Dialogue: Well, I want to go get my asthma inhaler, but it might ruin the moment.

00:11:34:180000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:34:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:34:180000.Dialogue: Just, just help me out here. How does a miserable date end in sex?

00:11:40:100000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:40:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:42:230000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:42:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:42:230000.Dialogue: Well, I'm a pretty smart guy, and right now my brain has dibs on the blood supply, so give it a go.

00:11:49:030000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:49:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:49:030000.Dialogue: Okay, it's just, at the restaurant when you said you wanted us to be together again, it got very real very fast and I panicked.

00:11:59:220000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:11:59:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:59:220000.Dialogue: Why? What are you afraid of?

00:12:03:050000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:03:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:03:050000.Dialogue: Well, what if we do go out and I do something stupid and dump you again?

00:12:07:130000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:07:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:13:060000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:13:060000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:15:190000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:15:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:15:190000.Dialogue: Well, how about if we don't think about this as a relationship? It could be more like a new version of software. Penny and Leonard 2.0.

00:12:24:190000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:24:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:24:190000.Dialogue: We can test it internally, shake out the bugs, and if we both feel it's solid, then we'll roll it out to the public.

00:12:31:190000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:31:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:31:190000.Dialogue: So we don't tell people we're back together?

00:12:34:180000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:34:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:34:180000.Dialogue: Exactly. We pretend like our date went badly.

00:12:37:190000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:37:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:37:190000.Dialogue: Well, we don't really have to pretend.

00:12:39:230000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:39:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:39:230000.Dialogue: And we let them think that we decided to just be friends and that everything's cool.

00:12:45:070000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:45:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:45:070000.Dialogue: Okay, great. Hey, I just remembered. I still got one of your inhalers.

00:12:54:100000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:54:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:54:100000.Dialogue: I can't believe you kept this.

00:12:56:150000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:56:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:56:150000.Dialogue: Yeah, I was gonna throw it away, but I just couldn't.

00:12:59:070000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:12:59:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:05:190000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. They are in bed.
00:13:05:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:05:190000.Dialogue: In 25 to 30 minutes I'm gonna show you how much this means to me.

00:13:22:040000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:22:040000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:22:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:22:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:25:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:25:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:27:220000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:27:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:27:220000.Dialogue: Uh, can't complain. Thanks for asking.

00:13:32:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:32:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:32:170000.Dialogue: Well, what were you doing out at 3:00 in the morning?

00:13:35:190000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:35:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:35:190000.Dialogue: Well, uh, uh... what are you doing up?

00:13:39:160000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:39:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:42:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:42:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:46:040000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:46:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:46:040000.Dialogue: Really? I didn't see you in there.

00:13:52:180000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:13:52:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:52:180000.Dialogue: Obviously... when I saw that you were in ours, I went and used another one.

00:14:01:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:01:030000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:04:000000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:04:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:04:000000.Dialogue: The, the gas station across the street.

00:14:07:190000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:07:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:09:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:09:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:12:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:12:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:15:220000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:15:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:18:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:18:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:23:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:23:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:28:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:28:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:28:150000.Dialogue: Seems unlikely. Did you bring your asthma inhaler?

00:14:33:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:33:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:33:030000.Dialogue: Uh, uh, uh, yes, I did.

00:14:39:180000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:39:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:39:180000.Dialogue: Well, then, I guess it's plausible.

00:14:43:010000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:43:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:43:010000.Dialogue: D-- hang on a second, mister.

00:14:45:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:45:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:46:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:46:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:46:080000.Dialogue: After you used the facilities at the gas station, did you make a purchase?

00:14:52:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:52:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:54:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:14:54:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:54:030000.Dialogue: It's customary, when using the restroom at a retail establishment, to make a small purchase. Did you?

00:15:01:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:15:01:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:04:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:15:04:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:09:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:15:09:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:18:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:15:18:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:23:160000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:15:23:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:23:160000.Dialogue: It's not about you. It's about a poor immigrant from Pakistan trying to make his way in America by working the graveyard shift at the Colorado Boulevard Chevron.

00:15:35:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:15:35:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:40:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is sneaking back in.
00:15:40:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:45:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:45:070000.Dialogue: Leonard will be here in a moment. He's looking for a different parking space.

00:15:50:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:50:100000.Dialogue: We were next to a car with an Ask me about my grandchildren bumper sticker, and I was afraid if we ran into them on the way out, I'd be obligated to do so.

00:16:00:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:00:230000.Dialogue: I'm so disappointed it didn't work with him and Penny.

00:16:04:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:04:120000.Dialogue: Me, too. Out of deference to them, let's not flaunt our happy relationship.

00:16:10:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:10:190000.Dialogue: You have a keen insight into the human heart, Amy Farrah Fowler.

00:16:16:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:16:190000.Dialogue: We are next to a Suburu with a Gore/Lieberman bumper sticker.

00:16:20:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:20:210000.Dialogue: Well, I doubt they'd want to talk about that, so we're fine.

00:16:25:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:25:030000.Dialogue: I'm surprised to see you here after it went so badly with Penny.

00:16:29:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:29:040000.Dialogue: Well, hey, we're grown-ups. We can still be friends.

00:16:32:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:32:060000.Dialogue: Boy, I don't know if I could be friends with Howie if we broke up.

00:16:47:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:47:050000.Dialogue: Here you go, guys, let me get you going with some water. You need menus or you know what you want?

00:16:50:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:50:180000.Dialogue: Leonard knows what he wants, but it looks like he's not gonna get it from you.

00:16:55:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:55:050000.Dialogue: No, that's okay, Bernadette. Sometimes these things just don't work out.

00:17:00:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:00:080000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's all good. We-We'll always have feelings for each other.

00:17:09:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:09:050000.Dialogue: See, she knew what always meant.

00:17:12:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:12:090000.Dialogue: Wow, you're like a dog with a bone, aren't you?

00:17:17:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:17:100000.Dialogue: Is the point that you don't know when to let something go?

00:17:19:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:19:220000.Dialogue: People, people, please, before you say something you both regret, I'd like to place my order.

00:17:26:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:26:220000.Dialogue: Yeah, just hang on, Sheldon. You know why we can't be together? Because you always have to be right.

00:17:32:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:32:220000.Dialogue: I got to go with Leonard on this. He is wrong more than anyone I know.

00:17:37:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:37:160000.Dialogue: You know what? I just realized I'm on a break. I'll get someone else.

00:17:42:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:42:100000.Dialogue: Leonard, promise me that when our new waitress comes over, you will not start a complicated on-again, off-again relationship with her, because I am very, very hungry.

00:18:08:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:08:160000.Dialogue: Mind explaining to me why you were being such a jerk at the restaurant?

00:18:10:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:10:070000.Dialogue: Well, I was trying to act like we weren't seeing each other. That was the plan, right?

00:18:13:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:13:170000.Dialogue: No, the plan was to tell people we decided to stay friends. That's a little hard to do when you're always being such a tool bag.

00:18:22:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:22:040000.Dialogue: You know what? I don't have to stand here and take this crap.

00:18:24:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:24:230000.Dialogue: The hell do you think you're going?

00:18:26:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:26:200000.Dialogue: Isn't sex after fighting kind of what we do now?!

00:18:43:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:43:190000.Dialogue: Every scenario I play out for you and me ends badly.

00:18:49:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:49:210000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Leonard, are you listening to me?

00:18:53:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:53:140000.Dialogue: This is a disaster. I distinctly ordered the Leonard Nimoy Mr. Spock cardboard standee. Why would I feel safer with Zachary Quinto at the foot of my bed?

00:19:04:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:04:210000.Dialogue: I don't know, he was pretty badass on Heroes.

00:19:09:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:09:030000.Dialogue: You're right, I'll give him a shot.

00:19:14:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:14:080000.Dialogue: Hang on. Penny, do you have plans for dinner?

00:19:19:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:19:120000.Dialogue: No, I mean just you and me.

00:19:24:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:24:050000.Dialogue: Uh, have you thought this through?

00:19:26:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:26:170000.Dialogue: Yes, and I think we should go anyway.

00:19:32:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:32:230000.Dialogue: No, can't do it. Sorry, Quinto, you're going back.

00:19:45:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:45:010000.Dialogue: If you and Leonard get back together, Sheldon and I will finally have someone to go on double dates with.

00:19:51:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:51:080000.Dialogue: Fine, we can double with you, too. So insecure.

00:19:58:030000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:58:030000.Dialogue: Where are you guys going to eat?

00:20:05:010000.Speaker: Minister
00:20:05:010000.Dialogue: Do you, Penny, take Leonard to be your lawful wedded husband?

00:20:17:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:17:130000.Dialogue: Well, it's a little late for me to start saying no, isn't it?

00:20:25:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:25:010000.Dialogue: Sorry, just remembered I've got to stop at the drugstore.
